meanings.definition: A person who operates a telegraph machine.
meanings.sent1: The telegraphers at the station sent messages across long distances.
meanings.sent2: The telegraphers were skilled in transmitting messages using Morse code.
meanings.sent3: The telegraphers had a competition to see who could send the fastest message.
meanings.sent4: The telegraphers' fingers danced across the keys of the telegraph machine.
meanings.sent5: The telegraphers were like modern-day messengers, connecting people far apart.

meanings.sent1: The telegraphers gathered at the telegraph office to send important messages.
meanings.sent2: There were many telegraphers working together to ensure efficient communication.
meanings.sent3: The telegraphers formed a club to discuss advancements in telecommunication.
meanings.sent4: The telegraphers' teamwork made the transmission of messages seamless.
meanings.sent5: The telegraphers' presence was crucial in the era of rapid communication.
